articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried's fraud trial has given an unprecedented window into how a group of graduates from elite U.S. universities in their late 20s and early 30s tried, and ultimately failed, to avert one of the biggest and swiftest corporate meltdowns ever.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried trial gives jury inside view of FTX's final days

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The euro zone is unlikely to see a new boom in consumption as savings accumulated during the COVID-19 pandemic are largely held by the richest households, the European Central Bank said in a blog posting on Thursday.
articles.title: ECB sees no consumption boom as rich have most of the savings

articles.author: Nia Williams, Maiya Keidan
articles.description: U.S. corporates and private equity firms are increasingly eyeing Canadian oil and gas companies for acquisition, drawn by lower valuations, ample fossil fuel reserves, and improving market access, according to dealmakers and analysts.
articles.title: Cheaper Canadian oil and gas valuations lure potential US buyers north

articles.author: Ross Kerber
articles.description: Swiss-based sustainability group Better Cotton said on Thursday it has added new functions to a platform that big retailers use to trace materials through their supply chains.
articles.title: Sustainable cotton group boosts tracking for top retailers

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Uber (UBER.N) and Lyft (LYFT.O) will pay a combined $328 million to settle claims by New York's attorney general that the ride-sharing companies systematically cheated drivers out of pay and benefits.
articles.title: Uber, Lyft to pay $328 million to settle New York wage theft claims

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's financial regulators are investigating a month-end liquidity crunch that saw short-term money rates surge to as much as 50%, asking some institutions to explain why they borrowed at extremely high rates, three sources said.
articles.title: China regulators probe liquidity stress that sent rates to record 50% - sources

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli tanks and troops pressed towards Gaza City on Thursday but met fierce resistance from Hamas militants using mortars and hit-and-run attacks from tunnels as the Palestinian death toll from nearly four weeks of bombardments mounted.
articles.title: Hamas fighters seek to block Israeli advance on Gaza City

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda will continue to dismantle the central bank's ultra-easy monetary policy settings and look to exit the decade-long accommodative regime sometime next year, an inherently risky plan that would require skilful execution.
articles.title: Exclusive: BOJ plans to exit from easy policy next year but needs some good fortune

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin on Thursday signed off on a law revoking Russia's ratification of the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty, a move he says is designed to bring Moscow into line with the United States.
articles.title: Putin revokes Russia's ratification of nuclear test ban treaty
